replikes.orig: Budget minded.  A little more conscious of other peoples money.  I like their foreign policies.  Just more concerned about foreign policy and they are not as weak as Democrats.

The Republican party encourages private competition which I think is economically healthy.  For example, the deregulation of the airlines and also buses were deregulated, weren't they?  This allowed other entrepreneurial people to get into, to operate businesses that had otherwise been closed.  Private enterprise is good.  I'll tell you another thing is that Air Atlanta, primarily a Black corporation.  It caters to Blacks.  It's run by Blacks or owned by Black people which proves the health of ethnic enterprises.  (A.E.) Clare Booth Luce.
demdislikes: The great giveaway program Its not like they really mean it In an election year youre not going to find anyone Democrat or Republican voting against Social Security I dislike political motivation Id like to see someone vote his conscience occasionally
demlikes.orig: The Democratic party is a compassionate party.  They honor working people and they do provide.

They're striving to help individuals  They stress finances of the middle class and the poor.  That's something that I've always admired about the Democrats.  That's always their main platform.  That's usually what their campaign speeches are about.  It's about meeting the needs of the people rather than the country as a whole.
Democrats are mostly for helping and providing better for the poor people to my notion.  Not cutting out food stamps and making sure poor people are taken care of.

repdislikes: The president has not used very good judgement in his selection of advisors as to capable people They smack of political favors past done The Republican party great favors and remember the Secretary of the Interior is another James Watt a poor selection
replikes.orig: They are more fiscally responsible.  They are not the wild spenders.  Most of the debt can be laid at the feet of the Democratic party and the Democratic Congress is spending too much money.
demdislikes: Reputation for spending and not showing where to get the money Always had a reputation for enlarging the bureaucracy of government

repdislikes: He thinks about overseas more than at home He flies back and forth rather than stay at home He has big suppers shown on TV They should only have desert with other people doing without I dont like to see them drinking on TV
replikes.orig: They have tried to help in some ways.  They have took welfare away from a lot of people and made them work.  They have tried to find jobs for less fortunate and handicapped.  On the other hand, he takes away from other people, cut my disability.
demdislikes: They all spend too much money
demlikes.orig: He gets up there and tells you if he's doing the taxes.  Reagan tells you nothing.  He tries to help the people who are unfortunate.  They are more for the people who are not well off, people between the poor and the rich.  He is more concerned about the U.S. than the foreign countries.

repdislikes: Although like to identify with the elite I dislike their tendency to appeal only to that group of people They tend to be too conservative on social issues like racial policies affirmative action They are less inclined to enforce affirmative action policies I dont like their policies against abortion
replikes.orig: They are identified with successful people and I like that.  Economically successful, upper middle class and higher income groups are generally Republicans.  I like that identification.  I want to be in that group.  Generally, I agree with their conservative attitude that government should take a lesser role.
demdislikes: I disagree with many of their policies Their economic policies tend to want to solve peoples problems by the use of the government and spending money So far as foreign policy is concerned I think they are softer on communism
demlikes.orig: They encompass a larger array of ethnic groups, a racial mix and a variety of people.  They are very universal.  They appeal to a broader cross section of Americans.  Some of their policies..I think they are more generous to Blacks and minorities and I like that.

repdislikes: They are more for big business
demlikes.orig: They seem to be more for the little guy.

repdislikes: Theyre not even acknowledging that there are poor people in this countrylike Meeses remark about food lines I dont like the way Reagan handles the defense He wont negotiate acts tough The national debt is huge because of defense spending
replikes.orig: I like the strong defense.  You can't separate the party from the man.  Republicans tried to cut some of the fat out of the budget instead of raising the taxes and that was good.
demdislikes: The way they are handling the presidential campaign They lack direction Mondale has switched horses and tried to change his personality and this should have been thought of long ago Not organized a lack of ironing out the details of the campaign before they got into it
demlikes.orig: They are more representative of the working class and represent the interests of the masses rather than of business and the very rich.  They are throwing up a facade of equality by putting Geraldine Ferraro up as vice president.  They struggle for equality of the minorities.

replikes.orig: Seem to look at the overall and emphasize old time values.  People are good, work well, get us through problems.  Better organized.
demdislikes: They forget about everyone other than the little man They pick up a small group such as gays and they keep forgetting they represent the whole society Their platforms are designed to help the small groups

replikes.orig: Their conservative approach in moral and economic issues--abortion, prayer in school, fiscal responsibility

repdislikes: In some ways they have given capitalism a few loopholes that need to be closed in all fairness I cant see some of the huge salaries for corporation presidents and the workers not getting as much as they could

demdislikes: They are too liberal The welfare state got out of hand I feel its been too much of a handout to minorities
demlikes.orig: I like their concern for the minorities as a whole.  Their concern on the nuclear issues.  I'm very strong on women having equal opportunities but I'm not for E.R.A.  I just don't think it's necessary.

demlikes.orig: I was just raised as a Democrat.  They come near doing what's right than the Republicans.

repdislikes: Their lack of compassion for underprivileged people and for minorities They are helping the moderately welltodo and the wealthy who are getting richer This seems to be their aim Their Trickle down theory of economy is demeaning

repdislikes: Theyre for the rich instead of the poor
demlikes.orig: They are for the poor.  Don't think they would spend a lot of money fixing the White House--new dishes and furniture that's not necessary.

replikes.orig: They are conservative and I am a conservative person.  I think they are more for the individual.  Individual enterprise.  Give the individual a break if they want it, not all government run things.

demdislikes: For this election theres no backbone in the party The 3 candidates that they are running before the Democratic convention might have had a better chance of winning if they werent Democrats If they were running on independent tickets The nation is looking for a leader instead of putting a party in office

demdislikes: Its lack of organization lack of focus
demlikes.orig: It has a wide variety of people in it.  It just goes to show you can turn race, creed or religion into a political hack.

repdislikes: Its more upper class the better off billionaire types Too pro business Slow to react In any given situation it takes too long to come up with a solution to a problem Its afraid of new situations Stuck in its ways Minorities not well represented The party is against era The party believes that business should have free reign little government control
demlikes.orig: More liberal.  More homogeneous.  Representative of the whole country.  It tends to be made up of the middle class.  More down to earth.  More idealistic.

replikes.orig: Generally more conservative and business oriented.
demdislikes: Liberal aspects Republicans closer to my conservative nature Government programs involving government spending Liberal philosophy which I dont like

repdislikes: Their foreign policy Every Republican has the same foreign policy basically It seems like when things get bad they get something going with some foreign country and then we make lots of weapons and planes and get the economy running that way That means high defense spending and they take it out of other programs for the people
demdislikes: When things get better and the economy is back they dont like to stop their programs Then everything gets abused

repdislikes: They are too strongly oriented toward big business Those that have get during the Republican administration They in the case of Reagan go overboard in cutting the social programs so that it hurts people who really do need help
demdislikes: Sometimes they are a little too liberal They go a little bit overboard on social programs They give a little bit too much of our money to the people who are not working who could work then they should

repdislikes: I dont like the fact that theyve been so slow and wasted 4 years and accomplished no more than they have I guess I expected a miracle probably a lot of other people did

replikes.orig: They are conservative and that's the way I'm leaning.  Military strength and economic policies such as the I.R.A.s.

replikes.orig: They seem to be more for helping the lower class people.

repdislikes: Theyre not for the poor Theyre for the rich

For example Roosevelt formed unions and brought us out of the great depression and then this guy is trying to break the unions.  Look what he did to air controllers.  The Democrats favor the poor and the underdog.  They're noted for that.

replikes.orig: I agree 90% with their overall values--abortion, women's rights, religion, gun control, defense.
demdislikes: Theyre for gun control and they seem to give too many freebies to people that dont really need it Its just that they dont want to work for it

replikes.orig: The way they are handling the affairs.  They're doing a good job.

repdislikes: Little too class conscious Too many rich and elite people who in power tend to use it for their own good
replikes.orig: The way they handle economics.  I'm conservative in economic issues.

repdislikes: Their attitude toward the poor If you work hard you can succeed Thats not always true Its just their general attitude toward the poor I dont share I dont agree about the enormous amount of defensive weapons they consider necessary

demlikes.orig: Their tradition of openness to everybody.  Just about everybody will be comfortable somewhere in the Democratic party.

repdislikes: Theyre stuck on the higher class and not worried about the lower class The rich get richer and the poor get poorer

demdislikes: They say they are going to do something but dont All you get are unanswered promises from the people in power

demdislikes: The tax issue They always seem to raise taxes to solve problems None of the leaders seem strong or forceful enough

demdislikes: Theyre liberal and Im not liberal They discredit Republicans with their campaign

repdislikes: Its going a little too far to the right but should rectify itself The infiltration of the church into the Republican party needs to be watched closely However the Republican party is up to this task and has my complete confidence not to let it get out of hand
replikes.orig: They try to represent the great majority of the American people.  They seem to genuinely care what happens to us and to our country.
demdislikes: Trying to legalize gay rights which I consider a mental illness and should be treated as such They want to make this country a welfare state Although I was at one time a liberal and voted for people I thought were underprivileged I have seen in my public life that this was taken advantage of and not appreciated There are too many people that think the tax payers should support them because I as a liberal voter led them to believe that they did not have to work to get ahead I know of many cases of fraud and I am completely dismayed I know of people drawing unemployment that are working people drawing welfare that make more money than I do Also of non American citizens that have been given houses to live in that have low interest rates because they have lied about their income

replikes.orig: I like the vice president.  He is concerned about Latin America.  People at the head of the  Republican party are a good team--intelligent, capable, etc.  They try to make this country stronger so that our enemies respect us more.  This country has to be the leader of the world.  I like the conservativism of the Republican party.
demdislikes: They are not conscious of the vital problems that we have with communism in the Latin American countries which are so close by to US They do not recognize how dangerous it is Also many people run away from these countries to the US and how burdensome they are to the economy here They take away work that rightfully belongs to Americans Americans are concerned with what happens in their own country and do not realize how dangerous things that can happen in South America can be to North Americans When Americans are resentful they have a right to be I am opposed to the lack of morality of the Democratic party with its gay rights and all those things I am also against a woman vice president

replikes.orig: Their conservatism.  He's like to cut down on many entitlement.  I like it all the way through.  For instance, I think families should help their own.   helped.  The government should not give handouts to them.

repdislikes: Probably the unfair tax structure I associate the Republican party with tax loopholes for the rich Sometimes I feel they are too conservative They like the status quo
replikes.orig: Strong economic policies.  They've got big business on their side.
demdislikes: Im concerned with their open arms policy toward every minority that comes along I feel they are trying to please all of the people all of the time by embracing every minority For example theyd like to have every gay vote every Black vote Im not saying thats bad but minorities can become special interest groups
demlikes.orig: I think the inclusion of women in politics, maybe their more liberal slant toward the average American.  I don't feel they are satisfied with the status quo.  I think they'd like to change more of the inequalities.

Having always been a Democrat, I will say they always judge the candidate on what he stands on.  They don't always look at their bank accounts.  They look at their qualities.  Always seemed they were thinking about the ordinary people.

repdislikes: They are for the wealthy people The tax benefits and everything The way the system is set up the rich people have so many loopholes They dont pay taxes percentagewise like the middle class and poor

Probably the farmers benefit from the Democratic party--the grain and the prices for grain.  My brother tells that many small farmers are losing their farms because of the high interest rates and the cost of fertilizer and seed because it is so expensive.

replikes.orig: The Republicans is the one that is trying to help make things a lot better.

repdislikes: The party is a little more conservative on social matters and is pro defense buildup than Id like to see Prayer in school antiabortion anti planned parenthood things like that

demdislikes: The party is a little more liberal than I am Their feelings of equal rights and that we have to compensate for past unequal rights They go more overboard than I would

repdislikes: Reagan I havent got any good feelings for him
demlikes.orig: They got a good man running and a good vice president.  I like the promises Mondale makes if he keeps them.  He promised to help us out of the economic crisis.  He's trying to make friends with other countries.

They should be dealing with other nations better Our relations should be improved I think a way could be found to deal successfully with them without there being the threat of nuclear war
replikes.orig: The Republicans attempt to straighten out the budget, to improve the economy.  To improve, that is, to decrease the unemployment rate.  Their record is very good on this, although it cannot be done overnight.  It takes time to see the results.  The lowering of cost of living increases and the reduction in interest rates.
demdislikes: Their spending habits Every time a Democrat is in office there is a definite increase in spending They promise to balance the budget but instead they make it worse As they make it worse increase spending there is more money in the market resulting therefore in decreasing the value of the dollar and increasing the cost of living and making things worse again This results in raising interest rates Unemployment skyrockets
demlikes.orig: They tend to prefer peace and a discontinuation of the arms race more than the Republican party.  They want to see a slowing down of the nuclear warheads that are being put into Europe.  They seem to be strongly in favor of coming up with some form of a peace treaty with the other large nations--like China and the Soviet Union.

demlikes.orig: Their emphasis on providing a reasonable means of life for everyone.  Their emphasis on social programs. training programs for women, and providing child care programs so that mothers can work.

demlikes.orig: They are more open to the overall view of all the people.  The Republicans seem to be a more closely knit party.  Democrats reach out to everybody, to help everybody.

They've improved employment.

I don't think it's the party so much as the man running the party.  On our trade, I think we should shut down some of our imports to balance it out such as Japan on the autos, Brazil on the coffee.

replikes.orig: He's done all he could.  We've all got along.  He's helped the poor all he could.  Worked for social security.  Tried to keep prices up as good as he could on hogs, cattle, corn.  Got the interest down a little.

demlikes.orig: They're not a money man's party like some.  They don't cater to the rich as much.  They're more fair to more people, to the working class.  They cover more area.  They were out for social programs to poor, school lunches.  They always had a better feeling for farm areas.  They are more open on their politics.  We hear more of what's going on every day, not a month afterwards.  They work more with people so they know more what's happening at all times.  They aren't so blunt with the working class.
